section.title: What is the Gradle Continuous mode?
section.para: When run in continuous mode, Gradle will execute a build and determine any files that are inputs to that build. Gradle will then watch for changes to those input files, and re-execute the build when any file changes.

section.title: How do I enable the Gradle Continuous mode?
section.para: The --watch command line switches enables the continous mode.

section.title: Continous mode details and known issues
New source directories won't be noticed
section.para: The continous mode will start watching only those source directories that exist when the build starts. Let's say src/test/groovy directory is missing and the user creates it just before adding a new source file. This change will stay unnoticed by the continous mode.

section.title: No native file system notifications on Mac OS X
section.para: Despite the Java JVM has the WatchService API since Java 7, this API doesn't have a native implementation on Mac OS X in Java 7 or Java 8. JDK-7133447 is the open issue in the Java bug tracker. The Java JVM uses a polling implementation of the WatchService API on Mac OS X for filesystem events. That has longer latency than the native implementations used on Windows and Linux and doesn't scale so well for very large projects with lots of source directories.
